com.arangodb

Interface ArangoDBAsync

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.arangodb.ArangoSerializationAccessor

    public interface ArangoDBAsync
extends com.arangodb.ArangoSerializationAccessor
    Central access point for applications to communicate with an ArangoDB server.

    Will be instantiated through ArangoDBAsync.Builder 

     ArangoDBAsync arango = new ArangoDBAsync.Builder().build();
 ArangoDBAsync arango = new ArangoDBAsync.Builder().host("127.0.0.1", 8529).build();
    Author:
    Mark Vollmary

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ArangoDBAsync.Builder
      Builder class to build an instance of ArangoDBAsync.

      • createUser

        CompletableFuture<com.arangodb.entity.UserEntity> createUser(String user,
                                                             String passwd)
        Create a new user. This user will not have access to any database. You need permission to the _system database in order to execute this call.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the user
        passwd - The user password
        Returns:
        information about the user
        See Also:
        API Documentation

        passwd - The user password
        options - Additional properties of the user, can be null

      • getUser

        Returns:

      • getUsers

        CompletableFuture<Collection<com.arangodb.entity.UserEntity>> getUsers()

        informations about all users

      • updateUser

        CompletableFuture<com.arangodb.entity.UserEntity> updateUser(String user,
                                                             com.arangodb.model.UserUpdateOptions options)
        Partially updates the data of an existing user. The name of an existing user must be specified in user. You can only change the password of your self. You need access to the _system database to change the active flag.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the user
        options - Properties of the user to be changed
        Returns:
        information about the user
        See Also:
        API Documentation

      • replaceUser

        CompletableFuture<com.arangodb.entity.UserEntity> replaceUser(String user,
                                                              com.arangodb.model.UserUpdateOptions options)
        Replaces the data of an existing user. The name of an existing user must be specified in user. You can only change the password of your self. You need access to the _system database to change the active flag.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the user
        options - Additional properties of the user, can be null
        Returns:
        information about the user
        See Also:
        API Documentation

      • grantDefaultDatabaseAccess

        CompletableFuture<Void> grantDefaultDatabaseAccess(String user,
                                                   com.arangodb.entity.Permissions permissions)
        Sets the default access level for databases for the user user. You need permission to the _system database in order to execute this call.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the user
        permissions - The permissions the user grant
        Returns:
        void
        Since:
        ArangoDB 3.2.0
